intro: Bothriocline duemmeri, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ironweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and often hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a rough texture, and it produces small, dark purple to reddish flowers. The plant is known for its hardiness and ability to withstand dry conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
